page.title: 13Arable farming year.
page.content: In our area the farmer starts by ploughing the field so that it turns the soil over. Next comes a harrow pulled by a tractor which breaks up the lumps of soil. Then comes the drill which plants the seeds into the soil.Then the soil is rolled flat by heavy rollers. Some crops are planted in autumn and grow over winter,others are drilled in the spring time.Spraying is carried out at various times during the growing season, to protect the crop from weeds,mostly by tractor. In autumn the farmer uses a combine harvester which cuts and threshes the corn. Tractors come with trailers to take away the grain.This is stored in large bins then sold.The straw left on the field is either baled for cattle bedding or more commonly nowadays burnt with the stubble.
